text:
In the current output of cvschangelog, the date and time elements are parts of 
the whole changelog entry.
Wouldn't it be better to have it per file, and allow to regroup files that 
where commited more than 1 minute appart with the same message?

Current output is:
<changelog>
  <entry>
    <date>2002-03-06</date>
    <time>12:00</time>
    <author>Peter Donald</author>
    <file>
      <name>org/apache/myrmidon/build/AntlibDescriptorTask.java</name>
      <revision>1.3</revision>
      <prevrevision>1.2</prevrevision>
    </file>
    <msg><![CDATA[cvs message]></msg>
  </entry>
</changelog>

Could be modified to be
<changelog>
  <entry>
    <author>Peter Donald</author>
    <file>
      <name>org/apache/myrmidon/build/AntlibDescriptorTask.java</name>
      <revision>1.3</revision>
      <prevrevision>1.2</prevrevision>
      <date>2002-03-06</date>
      <time>12:00</time>
    </file>
    <msg><![CDATA[cvs message]></msg>
  </entry>
</changelog>
creator: patrick.martin@sungard.com

text:
This change would require adding a new attribute to the cvschangelog task to
allow the ant users to choose the new format, so it would make the manual still
a bit thicker.
I see the change as a low priority, since you can almost certainly reformat the
XML generated by ant with a style sheet to make it fit your needs.
creator: antoine@apache.org
bodewig@apache.org
text:
unless anybody contributes the code for an optional attribute changing the output (we can't change it by default without breaking backwards compatibility) this is never going to be done.

Changing it to WONTFIX.
